name.namePart: United States. Office of Coast Survey

physicalDescription.extent: 1 map : 109 x 46 cm, on sheet 116 x 51 cm

mods.note: C. P. Patterson Superintendent ; verification by C. A. Schott, Assistant in charge of Office ; triangulation by R. D. Cutts and J. J. Gilbert ... the coast line is from the surveys by J. J. Gilbert ... that of the entrance to the Columbia River is from the surveys by C. Rockwell ... the off shore soundings were made in July and August 1877 by Lieut. Comdr. G. W. Coffin ... the bar of the Columbia River is from the survey made by E. Cordell ... astronomical and magnetic observations by George Davidson ... also magnetic observations by W. Eimbeck in 1873.
Depths shown by bathymetric soundings.
Latitudinal and longitudinal lines along margins.
Compass roses.
2 bar scales on chart, given in "Kilometers" and "Nautical Miles."
Shows coastline, depths, and lighthouses.
Descriptive text includes information on currents, dangers, tides, soundings, and "Moon's declination."
Seal: United States Coast Survey.
"No. 639 Price 40 cents".
